result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane C Amrhein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 2 days Huber consecutive for non-payment.
Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 7:00 p.m. on 2/26/2016.

DNA Surcharge waived.
Defendant to provide a DNA Sample if not previously done.

Defendant Shane C Amrhein in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Babe makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #4.  
10 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 7:00 PM on 2/26/2016.
COSTS:  $243.00
DNA surcharge waived.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample if not previously done.  
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 2 days in Huber consecutive

Defendant Shane C Amrhein in court.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not qualify for a public defender.  Court steps down to fill out paperwork.  Court reconvenes at 10:09 am.  Defendant is requesting a court appointed attorney.  Court grants request and will appoint counsel.  Defendant to repay appointment at $100.00 a month commencing 10/1/2015.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with codefendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Shane C Amrhein in court.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
